name: AWS DynamoDB
description: This app supports CRUD operations in a AWS DynamoDB database

use_role.description: Use attached role when running Phantom in EC2

actions.description: Fetch metadata of a global table

actions.verbose:
• This action is used to create a table on DynamoDB
  • Each table has a Primary Key to identify items uniquely. The primary in DynamoDB is made up of Partition Key and Sort Key. Sort is Optional, but once the table is created you cannot add/update Sort Key
  • The date types that can be used for keys are:
    • String
    • Number
    • Binary
  • The Billing mode defines how you going to be charged for read and write throughput and how you manage capacity. This setting can be changed later. By default the value for Billing Mode is PROVISIONED.
    • PROVISIONED We recommend using PROVISIONED for predictable workloads. PROVISIONED sets the billing mode to Provisioned Mode.
    • PAY_PER_REQUEST We recommend using PAY_PER_REQUEST for unpredictable workloads. PAY_PER_REQUEST set the billing mode to On-Demand Mode.
  • The Read/Write Capacity values by default are 5 units and auto scaling is disable.
  • Secondary Indexes
    • For creating Local Secondary Index (LSI) and Global Secondary Index (GSI), please refer the documentation above.
    • Once created local secondary index cannot be added/updated, but Global Secondary can be created.
  • A DynamoDB stream is an ordered flow of information about changes to items in a DynamoDB table. When you enable a stream on a table, DynamoDB captures information about every modification to data items in the table. To enable streams for table, check the enable stream checkbox and select the stream view type from Dropdown.
    • KEYS_ONLY - Only the key attributes of the modified item are written to the stream.
    • NEW_IMAGE - The entire item, as it appears after it was modified, is written to the stream.
    • OLD_IMAGE - The entire item, as it appeared before it was modified, is written to the stream.
    • NEW_AND_OLD_IMAGES - Both the new and the old item images of the item are written to the stream.
  • SSE
    • Set it to true to use server-side encryption.
    • For the KMS master key id provide the KMS key value that should be used for encryption.

actions.description: List the global tables from the database
List all the backups present in the database

exclusive_start_backup_arn.description: List tables backups after specific given backup name

max_items.description: Maximum backups to get in a call

start_date.description: List tables created after provided date.(Valid date format allowed: YYYY/MM/DD

end_date.description: List tables created before provided data.(Valid date format allowed: YYYY/MM/DD)

actions.description: Create a backup of an existing table

restore_secondary_indexes.default: Restore the table without secondary indexes
value_list: Restore the table without secondary indexes

actions.description: List all the tables present in the database

max_items.description: Maximum number of items to list

actions.description: Delete a table from the database
Create a table in the database
actions.verbose:
NOTE

  • All the keys(partition & sort) in Dynamodb have only three supported datatypes [String,Number,Binary]

  • Billing Mode has two values, by default it will be set to PROVISIONED.

    • PROVISIONED: Sets the billing mode to Provisioned Mode
    • PAY PER REQUEST: Sets the billing mode to On-Demand Mode

    When the billing mode is Provisioned, read and write capacity becomes required parameters. The values for read and write capacity units are default set to 5. Also, auto-scaling is disabled.

  • If stream are enabled you need to select stream view type. There are four options you could select from:

    • KEYS ONLY: Only the key attributes of the modified item are written to the stream.
    • NEW IMAGE: The entire item, as it appears after it was modified, is written to the stream.
    • OLD IMAGE: The entire item, as it appeared before it was modified, is written to the stream.
    • NEW AND OLD IMAGES: Both the new and the old item images of the item are written to the stream.

  • The KMS key that should be used for the KMS encryption. To specify a key, use its key ID, Amazon Resource Name (ARN), alias name, or alias ARN. Note that you should only provide this parameter if the key is different from the default DynamoDB key alias/aws/dynamodb

  • To learn the way of taking input for local and global secondary index, please refer the documentation provided above for Local and Global Secondary Index.
  • To add tags to you table, follow the step given below
    • For a single values for tags, pass a JSON object. The JSON object should contain the 'Key' and 'Value' keys. These two keys are required and without these adding tags won't be possible. 
       { 'Key' : 'key_data', 'Value' : 'value_data' }
    • For multiple values in tags, pass a list of JSON object. 
       [ { 'Key' : 'key_data1', 'Value' : 'value_data1' }, { 'Key' : 'key_data2', 'Value' : 'value_data2' } ]
.

table_name.description: Name of table to be created

billing_mode.description: Billing mode to be used for table

partition_key_name.description: Partition key name for table items

sort_key_name.description: Sort key name for table items

read_capacity_units.description: Read capacity units for provisioned mode

write_capacity_units.description: Write capacity units for provisioned mode

local_secondary_index.description: JSON input for creating local secondary index

global_secondary_index.description: JSON input for creating global secondary index

sse.description: Settings used to enable server-side encryption

kms_master_key_id.description: The KMS key that should be used for the KMS encryption

tags.description: List of tags to add to table

actions.description: Delete an item from the table

table_name.description: Table name to delete item from

condition_expression.description: Condition to be check before delete an item

actions.description: Add an item to the table

table_name.description: Name of table in which you want to add the item

item_json.description: Item that is to be added in the table

condition_expression.description: Condition to be checked before inserting an item

actions.description: Update an item in the table

table_name.description: Name of table in which item is to be updated

actions.description: Get an item from the table
actions.verbose: We don't need to pass value in encoded format for the parameters.

table_name.description: Name of table from which you want to fetch item

attributes_to_get.description: To fetch specific attributes from the item

reserved_keyword_attributes.description: To fetch attributes from items whose names are same as reserved keywords

index_name.description: Name of Table to perform query on

filter_expression.description: Expression to filter data from table

projection_expression.description: Attributes to be included in the result

select.description: Attributes to be included in the result

return_consumed_capacity.description: Attributes to be included in the result

max_items.description: Maximum number of items to process

sort_descending.description: Attributes to be included in the result

consistent_read.description: Attributes to be included in the result
